intro: Klasea nana, commonly known as the dwarf klasea, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically reaches a height of no more than 10 centimeters, with small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Klasea nana thrives in nutrient-poor, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons.
